Posts.Content: Have you considered looking into finding a "naturalist" in your area that would be willing to help you do some liver detoxing???? I am not sure what your survival rate would be, I too have breast with mets to bones and at first they saw something on my liver.... I went to my naturapath and we started working on the detox and  my next scan came back clean for the spot they had seen on my liver...... I am a stage IV cancer patient, but not stage IV for the liver.... But I highly recommend doing something that won't interfer with your standard treatments and could actually be helpful to your liver..... Where do you live???? Maybe I can help you find someone in your area to work with you...... all the best, Yancy
Posts.Title: Stage IV Liver Cancer/Longevity?

Posts.Content: Dear Bette, I can't remember if I have tried to contact you lately or not.... I have not been on this site in sometime now and hope to reach you.  I have really been wondering how everyone is doing that I made contact with about 6 months ago.... I hope you are hanging in there and still have lots of support... Did you enjoy your summer with son?  Any health changes with you, for the good I hope.  I am still of course doing chemotherapy and am currently on the drugs avastin and navilbene.  My hair is starting to come back from the last round of chemo... I had to have some more radiation to my spinal area , the cancer was starting to eat thru to the nerve area.  My doctor at Duke Unv. wanted a tumor biopsy done out of my liver so we could see whether or not the genetics of the cancer has changed or not and it hasn't... We have just been having a hard time finding something that will work for the liver.  The bones seem to be stable at this point. Well, I hope you feel well enough to respond and I look forward to your email.... Yancy
Posts.Title: breast w/mets to liver

Posts.Content: Dear Tammy, Hi, I am hoping to reconnect with some of the ones I met earlier this year.  It has been awhile since I have been to the site and of course we are all busy.  I have just been trying to see how you are doing with your treatment and where you are in your treatments?  Are things going good for you?  Are you still able to work, I think you said that you are a nurse right? How about the spots on your liver, what is up them? My spots on my liver have not responded yet to anything I have been on in the past 6 months and so or course we are on a new treatment regime now... It is avastn and navilbene.... At least my bones seem to be stable at the moment and my last scans showed no new lesions... I am thankful for that.  How are your children doing now that school is back in?  My son just started college and seems to like it so far. Well, I hope to hear from you and look forward to an email. yancy

Posts.Title: breast w/mets to liver

Posts.Content: We have been treating my metastises of the breast cancer to my bones now for almost a year and finally it seems like something is starting to work (xeloda).... But with that said, we found out last week that it is now on the liver.  Found through a CAT scan .  I have been on a blinded trial for "avistan" and so they (the docs.) are going to find out if I was actually getting the drug or not...  If not, I will immediatly start gettting it. Will be getting a PET scan on Thursday and am terrified that things really will be as bad as they are.  Is there anyone out there going thru anything like me??? I am trying not to think about it being on an organ, but I know nobody in my area with anything like this.  Even at the clinic, I am the youngest person usually there (am 39).  Not too many people with mets breast cancer stage IV. Yancy
Posts.Title: breast w/mets to liver

Posts.Content: Dear Lisa, I have been trying to catch up with some people lately.  I haven't been on the site in some time and have found that most of the people I had been talking to don't seem to be on the site either.  I hope everyone is okay. Did you make it to Williamsburg this summer. I hope you had a great time with your family. So, how are you doing, are you feeling okay... Are doing the home schooling thing this year?  My best friend just started home schooling her two boys this school year.  They are in 4th and 2nd grade and also my nephew is home schooled he is in the 7th grade, they all love it.  I was fortunite enough to be in a really good school system here in Poquoson.  So, I hope your kids are doing great. I am of course still on chemotherapy treatments, I am currently taking avastin and navilbene, every week.  My bones seem to be stable right now and I don't have any new lesions but my liver is still not responding to anything.  Just had a liver tumor biopsy, they had to go 8 cm down into my liver to get the biopsy and of course didn't give me any meds but a local.  What a joy that was.  I have just started doing some acupuncture to stimulate my immune system and help with my back pain... Seems to be helping.  I actually mopped my kitchen floor the other day, something "I" haven't done in over a year. Well, I hope you are doing well and I look forward to hearing from you Yancy
Posts.Title: breast w/mets to liver

Posts.Content: Dear Rhonda, I am sooo excited to finally meet someone who is my age etc.  Not excited that we have this awful disease!!!  My primary cancer was in my left breast too, I had found a lump in my left arm pit, by the time I got it biopsied it was already stage III.  I also had 2 more tumors in the breast itself.  I underwent 5 months of chemo (every 21 days), I had previously had a partial hysterectomy and so after the chemo they put me on "lupron" and "tamoxifen".  Since all of my cancer is estrogen postive, the lupron kept me in "menopause".  Well, then we had the radiation to the left side and 4 months later I had the tram-flap reconstruction surgery.  Just this past december I went ahead and got the uterus taken out too so that I could get off of the lupron and since the tamoxifen wasn't working for me they took me off of that when I ended up in the hospital for 12 days because I couldn't walk. Why did they not do any chemo or radiation on you???? I don't understand why they would take such a chance.... Anyway, none of my tumor markers went off in the time the cancer was coming back in my bones..... I let the pain in my lower back go on for WAY TOO LONG (i no longer let any pain go for more than 2 weeks) before I asked for an MRI... Last July is when they said my entire pelvic area was loaded with tumors.... Now of course almost all of my bones have some cancer in them.... My spine, my pelvis, femor bones, upper arm bones, sternum, front skull, ribs.  I had a pain pump surgically put in me that feeds my spinal cord pain medicine, so that I can walk.  I also had radiation done to my pelvic area.  I notice you said that they found some in your hip.  I know that the bone pain can be unbearable at times, I hope that your doctors will help you with the pain, if you need it.  I too had bad news again on this past thursday (5-18).  My PET scan revealed exactly what my CAT scan did, that things are getting worse and that indeed there are bigger spots and more spots of cancer on the liver.....  I should find out tomorrow what the doc says he wants to do with the regime that I am on.  I was on the "femara" for about 6 months.... When I saw a specialist at Duke Unv.  She stated that "femara" is the number one drug right now for breast cancer.  I hope it works for you.  She was a doctor that only works with women who have breast cancer under the age of 40.  She talks with my doctor here in Virginia.  How have they treated did you say your mets to your liver????  Any side effects?  Oh yeah, why did you say that they can not give cancer patients "placebo's"? I hope to hear from you again and get to know you better.  My heart is with you, and even though I have the best support system here with me and lots of people to take care of me, no one really understands what it is like to be "us".  Thank you for responding . Yancy
Posts.Title: breast w/mets to liver

Posts.Content: Dear Mary, It has been a while since I have written anyone who is on this site... It has been a long summer.  My son graduated and some of my liver tumors have gotten bigger.. I just has a liver biopsy done where they had to go 8 cm down into the liver to get to the tumor they wanted to biopsy.  The doctor from Duke Unv.  wanted to see if any of the genetic of my cancer  has changed since non of the drugs I have been on for the past 6 months seem to be helping the liver.  I have even been on Avastin for at least 4 months now, and currently am on the chemo drug Navilbene... Are familiar with either of these drugs.  I have just been really concerned about how long they are going to be able to keep me going and it would be nice to hear from you since you so far a 4 year fighter with the whole liver thing. Would love to hear from you again. Yancy

Posts.Title: breast w/mets to liver

Posts.Content: On 5/14/2007 Sonia_329 wrote: Hi yancy   Sorry to hear your condition. My mom has metastatic breast cancer which spreaped to liver 2 yr ago and now in bone. She has just finished radiation and now going to strat xeloda with paclitaxol. xeloda works very good in shrinking the tumor in liver but she stoped it before cuz it caused severe hand and foot syndrome. but no other chemo worked 4 her so she is going to start it again. there is all ways hope. be positive and u will win the battle.   sonia    thanks for your reply.... for some reason the xeloda has finally started working for my mets to the bones, but has allowed the cancer to go to the liver.   I actually haven't had any reactions to the xeloda except for fatigur.I am waiting to find out if I was getting the placebo or not with trial  I have been on for "avastin"..... Maybe I wasn't and hopefully I can start getting the drug...... Did she (your mother) get radiation to her liver? I didn't know you could do that..... Yancy
Posts.Title: breast w/mets to liver

Posts.Content: I have been on xeloda now for a couple of weeks and also have experienced some of the fatigue... I mostly seem to have a day or two that all I can do is sleep.  May I ask why the rod had to be put into the femur??? I have mets breast cancer to the bones... My bones include the entire pelvic area, sternum, ribs, femurs, scapulas, entire spine and illalic bones, and the skull.... I have been experiencing lots of pain in my right leg.  I do have a pain pump inplanted in my right hip that runs a cath to my spine.  It constantly feeds pain meds to my nerves, so that I can walk and lead a pretty normal life.  I am also doing a "trial" at the same time for a drug called "avastin".  It has been approved for colon cancer, but not for breast cancer.... It is a blinded test and is supposed to be real close to fda approval.... I hope I am actually getting the drug.... I am only 39 and am terrified what my scans will show when I get them at the first of May.  So, I also have been taking some "B" complex to help with the fatigue and mostly I just push myself.  I am also anemic, since the cancer is in my bones..... I am on aranesip and zometa, the ararensip is suppose to help with the anemia, and the zometa with the strengthening of the bones..... Maybe your mom could do some of those things.
Posts.Title: Xeloda and fatigue
